publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1107# Trish Godman: Community Gardens-That the Parliament recognises the value of community gardening in improving health, building communities, increasing bio-diversity and promoting regeneration, while providing refreshment and healthy recreation for those without a garden; notes that such gardens face fierce competition for space in urban areas, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to help to secure the future of community gardens through revised planning guidance and by promoting them through the New Opportunities Fund.
S1M-1107# Community Gardens (lodged on 19 July 2000) Tommy Sheridan*, Shona Robison*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-1107# Community Gardens (lodged on 19 July 2000) Robin Harper*
S1M-1107# Community Gardens (lodged on 19 July 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1107# Community Gardens (lodged on 19 July 2000) Irene Oldfather*

S1M-1107# Trish Godman: Community Gardens-That the Parliament recognises the value of community gardening in improving health, building communities, increasing bio-diversity and promoting regeneration, while providing refreshment and healthy recreation for those without a garden; notes that such gardens face fierce competition for space in urban areas, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to help to secure the future of community gardens through revised planning guidance and by promoting them through the New Opportunities Fund. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Shona Robison, Pauline McNeill, Robin Harper, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Irene Oldfather
S1M-1107# Community Gardens (lodged on 19 July 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Andrew Wilson*

Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Shona Robison, Pauline McNeill, Robin Harper, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Irene Oldfather, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson, Elaine Smith
